creator: aturetta@bestunion.it
text:
After  build clean; build, log in to the default application as 'alice', select
the page 'Concepts (english Only)' from the authoring view, then switch to the
site view. You will see that available languages says 'en'.
Click on the 'de' tab of the site tree: you will see a german title for a page
which is only available in english. Now try to switch to the authoring view, and
watch a wonderful exception: org.apache.cocoon.ProcessingException: Language
Exception at <map:serialize>

Click 'back' on your browser. Click on 'Apache Lenya Links', you will be brought
back to the 'en' tree. Try again to switch to 'de'. Taa-daaa!! "No resource type
defined for document [default:authoring:/links:de]!".

What is the intended behaviour in case of missing pages in some of the
languages? Shouldn't the default language be displayed instead of an error?
Why the two different pages behave so differently? I guess some residual meta
information left from a previous version of the default pub.

The actual German document sources of the /concepts document exist, but it is
not referenced from the site tree ...
creator: andreas@apache.org
andreas@apache.org
text:
(In reply to comment #1)

[...]

> What is the intended behaviour in case of missing pages in some of the
> languages?

That should be up to the publication.

> Shouldn't the default language be displayed instead of an error?

Both options should be possible. Some customers want an error page with links to
the existing languages, other customers want a redirect to the default language.

The "no resource type" exception was caused by the module menus - they checked
for the current document's resource type, but the current document doesn't
exist. I added the checks to the XSPs - please review.
